result.execSummary:
The defendant Jake T Dircz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs on each count. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under Wis. Stat. 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation and all conditions.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Submit DNA sample.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 50 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency.

defendant.name: Dircz, Jake T

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Stone Harbor Resort, check no. 10433

Defendant Jake T Dircz in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress with State. State advises of offer. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Jake T Dircz in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Defendant can only appear by phone if case is not resolved and will be set for further scheduling. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 09:15 am.

No contact direct or indirect with Stone Harbor Resort. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Jake T Dircz in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/7/16 at 10:00.
